idea-plugin.name: Php Inspections (EA Ultimate)
idea-plugin.description:
A commercial Static Code Analyzer based on Php Inspections (EA Extended). News | Support | Pricing.

Php Inspections (EA Ultimate) is further extending IDE code analysis capabilities, with focus on finding defects, security, performance issues and maintainability. To get a closer look at features (30 new and 15 enhanced inspections) you are welcome to try it 2 weeks for free.

For Mac shortcuts, see this reference card. Windows/Linux ones are:
Alt + Shift + I to inspect current file with current profile
Ctrl + Alt + Shift + I to run inspection by name
Ctrl + Shift + F4 to close results of inspection.

On some projects CPU and therefore battery usage could be intensive, so it should be taken into account when traveling with a laptop.

Note: we are sending anonymous crash-reports and installation statistics to Google Analytics. You are welcome to review the implementation.
idea-plugin.change-notes:
New features release

- Changes from Php Inspections (EA Extended) v3.0.5
- New settings (Other Settings -> Php Inspections (EA Ultimate))

- One-time use variables: resolved false-positives (global context)
- 'array_keys(...)' misused: resolved a false-positive (array_slice)

- Empty/isset results correctness: new patterns
- Non-optimal regular expression: re-worked, added new patterns
- Repetitive method calls: new patterns
- Suspicious binary operations: new patterns
- 'array_flip(...)' can be used: implemented
- 'array_merge(...)' misused: new cases
- 'array_values(...)' misused: new patterns

localInspection.displayName: Callable calls in loops termination condition
Slow array function used in loop
Parameter could be declared as array
Statement could be decoupled from foreach
Suspicious usage of include_once/require_once return value
Class existence and relation check correctness
CURL: SSL server spoofing (SSL MITM and Spoofing Attacks)
Method name matches existing field name
Child method is exactly the same
Missing or empty conditionals group statement
Unnecessary last comma in array definition
Callable name case mismatched in a call
Null coalescing operator can be used
Short list syntax can be used
Return type hint can be used
Deprecated dynamic calls to scope introspection
Too many parameters in a callable
Class overrides a field of a parent class
